question.text: Which of the following option about various types of antibodies is correct?

options.text: The most abundant antibody is IgM and the antibody which is largest in size is IgG
The most abundant antibody is IgG and the antibody which is largest in size is IgM
IgA is the most abundant antibody as well as it appears as pentamer.
IgG is the most abundant antibody found in colostrum, while IgE is found in the case of hypersensitivity.

solution.text: There are five types of antibodies IgG, IgA, IgM, IgD, and IgE. IgG is the most abundant antibody-forming 80% of the total antibodies. It is the only antibody that can pass through the placenta. It is formed in the secondary immune response. It has a structure of a typical antibody having 4 peptides arranged in a Y shape manner. IgM is the largest in size (5 times greater than IgG). It is formed in the primary immune response. It is a pentamer having 5 such Y shaped structures.
